00017 package WeBWorK::Utils::Grades;
00018 use base qw(Exporter);
00019 
00020 use strict;
00021 use warnings;
00022 use Carp;
00023 
00024 our @EXPORT    = ();
00025 our @EXPORT_OK = qw(
00026     list_set_versions
00027 );
00028 
00029 ###########################
00030 # Utils::Grades
00031 #
00032 # Provides common grading methods for grading a set  or a versioned set
00033 ###########################
00034 
00035 ######################################################
00036 # build list of versioned sets for this student user
00037 # inputs:  $studentID, $setID
00038 # returns;    ref to array of names of set versions OR (if not versioned) the $setID
00039 #              notAssignedSet
00040 ######################################################
00041 
00042 sub list_set_versions {
00043     my ($db, $studentName, $setName, $setIsVersioned) = @_;
00044     return ("list_set_versions requires a database reference as the first element") unless ref($db)=~/DB/;
00045     my @allSetNames = ();
00046     my $notAssignedSet = 0;
00047     if ( $setIsVersioned ) {
00048         my @setVersions = $db->listSetVersions($studentName, $setName);
00049         @allSetNames = map { "$setName,v$_" } @setVersions;
00050         # if there aren't any set versions, is it because
00051         #    the user isn't assigned the set (e.g., is a 
00052         #    proctor), or because the user hasn't completed
00053         #    any versions?
00054         if ( ! @setVersions ) {
00055             $notAssignedSet = 1 if (! $db->existsUserSet($studentName,$setName));
00056         }
00057 
00058     } else {
00059         @allSetNames = ( "$setName" );
00060     }
00061     (\@allSetNames, $notAssignedSet);
00062 }
00063 
00064 
00065 
00066 1;
